arabic_text: يُسَبِّحُ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ لَهُ ٱلۡمُلۡكُ وَلَهُ ٱلۡحَمۡدُۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٌ
phonetic: 64.1 Yusabbiĥu Lillāhi Mā Fī As-Samāwāti Wa Mā Fī Al-'Arđi Lahu Al-Mulku Wa Lahu Al-Ĥamdu Wa Huwa `Alá Kulli Shay'in Qadīrun

translations.english_saheeh: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allāh.[1692] To Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth glorifies Allâh. His is the dominion, and to Him belong all the praises and thanks, and He is Able to do all things.
translations.english_rwwad: All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth glorifies Allah. To Him belongs the dominion, and to Him belongs all praise, and He is Most Capable of all things.

arabic_text: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكُمۡ فَمِنكُمۡ كَافِرٞ وَمِنكُم مُّؤۡمِنٞۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
phonetic: 64.2 Huwa Al-Ladhī Khalaqakum Faminkum Kāfirun Wa Minkum Mu'uminun Wa Allāhu Bimā Ta`malūna Başīrun

translations.english_saheeh: It is He who created you, and among you is the disbeliever, and among you is the believer. And Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He it is Who created you, then some of you are disbelievers and some of you are believers. And Allâh is All-Seer of what you do.
translations.english_rwwad: It is He Who created you, yet some of you are disbelievers and some of you are believers. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

arabic_text: خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَصَوَّرَكُمۡ فَأَحۡسَنَ صُوَرَكُمۡۖ وَإِلَيۡهِ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ
phonetic: 64.3 Khalaqa As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđa Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa Şawwarakum Fa'aĥsana Şuwarakum Wa 'Ilayhi Al-Maşīru

translations.english_saheeh: He created the heavens and earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He has created the heavens and the earth with truth, and He shaped you and made good your shapes. And to Him is the final Return.
translations.english_rwwad: He created the heavens and earth for a true purpose, He shaped you and perfected your form. And to Him is the final return.

arabic_text: يَعۡلَمُ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَيَعۡلَمُ مَا تُسِرُّونَ وَمَا تُعۡلِنُونَۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
phonetic: 64.4 Ya`lamu Mā Fī As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Ya`lamu Mā Tusirrūna Wa Mā Tu`linūna Wa Allāhu `Alīmun Bidhāti Aş-Şudūri

translations.english_saheeh: He knows what is within the heavens and earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And Allāh is Knowing of that within the breasts.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He knows what is in the heavens and on earth, and He knows what you conceal and what you reveal. And Allâh is the All-Knower of what is in the breasts (of men).
translations.english_rwwad: He knows all that is in the heavens and earth, and He knows whatever you conceal and whatever you reveal. And Allah is All-Knowing of what is in the hearts.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ يَأۡتِكُمۡ نَبَؤُاْ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن قَبۡلُ فَذَاقُواْ وَبَالَ أَمۡرِهِمۡ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ
phonetic: 64.5 'Alam Ya'tikum Naba'u Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Min Qablu Fadhāqū Wabāla 'Amrihim Wa Lahum `Adhābun 'Alīmun

translations.english_saheeh: Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Has not the news reached you of those who disbelieved aforetime? And so they tasted the evil result of their disbelief, and theirs will be a painful torment.
translations.english_rwwad: Has there not come to you the stories of those who disbelieved before you? They tasted the evil consequence of their deeds, and for them there will be a painful punishment.

arabic_text: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُۥ كَانَت تَّأۡتِيهِمۡ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتِ فَقَالُوٓاْ أَبَشَرٞ يَهۡدُونَنَا فَكَفَرُواْ وَتَوَلَّواْۖ وَّٱسۡتَغۡنَى ٱللَّهُۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَنِيٌّ حَمِيدٞ
phonetic: 64.6 Dhālika Bi'annahu Kānat Ta'tīhim Rusuluhum Bil-Bayyināti Faqālū 'Abasharun Yahdūnanā Fakafarū Wa Tawallaw Wa Astaghná Allāhu Wa Allāhu Ghanīyun Ĥamīdun

translations.english_saheeh: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and disbelieved and turned away. And Allāh dispensed [with them]; and Allāh is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
translations.english_hilali_khan: That was because there came to them their Messengers with clear proofs (signs), but they said: "Shall mere men guide us?" So they disbelieved and turned away (from the truth). But Allâh was not in need (of them). And Allâh is Rich (Free of all needs), Worthy of all praise.
translations.english_rwwad: That is because their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they said, “How can a human guide us?” Thus they disbelieved and turned away, but Allah had no need for them, for Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

arabic_text: زَعَمَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓاْ أَن لَّن يُبۡعَثُواْۚ قُلۡ بَلَىٰ وَرَبِّي لَتُبۡعَثُنَّ ثُمَّ لَتُنَبَّؤُنَّ بِمَا عَمِلۡتُمۡۚ وَذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٞ
phonetic: 64.7 Za`ama Al-Ladhīna Kafarū 'An Lan Yub`athū Qul Balá Wa Rabbī Latub`athunna Thumma Latunabba'uunna Bimā `Amiltum Wa Dhalika `Alá Allāhi Yasīrun

translations.english_saheeh: Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for Allāh, is easy."
translations.english_hilali_khan: The disbelievers pretend that they will never be resurrected (for the Account). Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): Yes! By my Lord, you will certainly be resurrected, then you will be informed of (and recompensed for) what you did; and that is easy for Allâh.
translations.english_rwwad: The disbelievers claim that they will never be resurrected. Say, “Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected, then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that is easy for Allah.”

arabic_text: فَـَٔامِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَٱلنُّورِ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنزَلۡنَاۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ خَبِيرٞ
phonetic: 64.8 Fa'āminū Billāhi Wa Rasūlihi Wa An-Nūri Al-Ladhī 'Anzalnā Wa Allāhu Bimā Ta`malūna Khabīrun

translations.english_saheeh: So believe in Allāh and His Messenger and the light [i.e., the Qur’ān] which We have sent down. And Allāh is Aware of what you do.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therefore, believe in Allâh and His Messenger (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) and in the Light (this Qur’ân) which We have sent down. And Allâh is All-Aware of what you do.
translations.english_rwwad: So believe in Allah and His Messenger, and in the Light [the Qur’an] that We have sent down. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَجۡمَعُكُمۡ لِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡجَمۡعِۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمُ ٱلتَّغَابُنِۗ وَمَن يُؤۡمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ وَيَعۡمَلۡ صَٰلِحٗا يُكَفِّرۡ عَنۡهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِۦ وَيُدۡخِلۡهُ جَنَّٰتٖ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدٗاۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡعَظِيمُ
phonetic: 64.9 Yawma Yajma`ukum Liyawmi Al-Jam`i Dhālika Yawmu At-Taghābuni Wa Man Yu'umin Billāhi Wa Ya`mal Şāliĥāan Yukaffir `Anhu Sayyi'ātihi Wa Yudkhilhu Jannātin Tajrī Min Taĥtihā Al-'Anhāru Khālidīna Fīhā 'Abadāan Dhālika Al-Fawzu Al-`Ažīmu

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1693]- "At-Taghābun" suggests having been outdone by others in the acquisition of something valued.  That Day, the disbelievers will suffer the loss of Paradise to the believers.

translations.english_saheeh: The Day He will assemble you for the Day of Assembly - that is the Day of Deprivation.[1693] And whoever believes in Allāh and does righteousness - He will remove from him his misdeeds and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (And remember) the Day when He will gather you (all) on the Day of Gathering, - that will be the Day of mutual loss and gain (i.e. loss for the disbelievers as they will enter the Hell-fire and gain for the believers as they will enter Paradise). And whosoever believes in Allâh and performs righteous good deeds, He will expiate from him his sins, and will admit him to Gardens under which rivers flow (Paradise) to dwell therein forever; that will be the great success.
translations.english_rwwad: When He will gather you for the Gathering Day; that is the Day of great loss. But whoever believes in Allah and does righteous deeds, He will absolve them of their bad deeds and will admit them to gardens under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. That is the supreme triumph.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَكَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَاۖ وَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ
phonetic: 64.10 Wa Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Wa Kadhabū Bi'āyātinā 'Ūlā'ika 'Aşĥābu An-Nāri Khālidīna Fīhā Wa Bi'sa Al-Maşīru

translations.english_saheeh: But the ones who disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding eternally therein; and wretched is the destination.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But those who disbelieved (in the Oneness of Allâh - Islâmic Monotheism) and denied Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), they will be the dwellers of the Fire, to dwell therein forever. And worst indeed is that destination[1].
translations.english_rwwad: As for those who disbelieve and reject Our verses, they will be the people of the Fire, abiding therein forever. What a terrible destination!

arabic_text: مَآ أَصَابَ مِن مُّصِيبَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِۗ وَمَن يُؤۡمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ يَهۡدِ قَلۡبَهُۥۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيۡءٍ عَلِيمٞ
phonetic: 64.11 Mā 'Aşāba Min Muşībatin 'Illā Bi'idhni Allāhi Wa Man Yu'umin Billāhi Yahdi Qalbahu Wa Allāhu Bikulli Shay'in `Alīmun

translations.english_saheeh: No disaster strikes except by permission of Allāh. And whoever believes in Allāh - He will guide his heart. And Allāh is Knowing of all things.
translations.english_hilali_khan: No calamity befalls, but by the Leave [i.e. Decision and Qadar (Divine Preordainments)] of Allâh, and whosoever believes in Allâh, He guides his heart [to the true Faith with certainty, i.e. what has befallen him was already written for him by Allâh from the Qadar (Divine Preordainments)]. And Allâh is the All-Knower of everything.[2]
translations.english_rwwad: No calamity befalls except with Allah’s permission. Whoever believes in Allah, He will guide his heart. And Allah is All-Knowing of everything.

arabic_text: وَأَطِيعُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُواْ ٱلرَّسُولَۚ فَإِن تَوَلَّيۡتُمۡ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَىٰ رَسُولِنَا ٱلۡبَلَٰغُ ٱلۡمُبِينُ
phonetic: 64.12 Wa 'Aţī`ū Allāha Wa 'Aţī`ū Ar-Rasūla Fa'in Tawallaytum Fa'innamā `Alá Rasūlinā Al-Balāghu Al-Mubīnu

translations.english_saheeh: And obey Allāh and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Obey Allâh, and obey the Messenger (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم); but if you turn away, then the duty of Our Messenger is only to convey (the Message) clearly.
translations.english_rwwad: Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, then the duty of Our Messenger is only to convey the message clearly.

arabic_text: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلۡيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ
phonetic: 64.13 Allāhu Lā 'Ilāha 'Illā Huwa Wa `Alá Allāhi Falyatawakkali Al-Mu'uminūna

translations.english_saheeh: Allāh - there is no deity except Him. And upon Allāh let the believers rely.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Allâh! Lâ ilâha illâ Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He). And in Allâh (Alone) therefore, let the believers put their trust.
translations.english_rwwad: Allah, none has the right to be worshiped except Him. So in Allah let the believers put their trust.

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِنَّ مِنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِكُمۡ وَأَوۡلَٰدِكُمۡ عَدُوّٗا لَّكُمۡ فَٱحۡذَرُوهُمۡۚ وَإِن تَعۡفُواْ وَتَصۡفَحُواْ وَتَغۡفِرُواْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمٌ
phonetic: 64.14 Yā 'Ayyuhā Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū 'Inna Min 'Azwājikum Wa 'Awlādikum `Adūwāan Lakum Fāĥdharūhum Wa 'In Ta`fū Wa Taşfaĥū Wa Taghfirū Fa'inna Allāha Ghafūrun Raĥīmun

translations.english_saheeh: O you who have believed, indeed, among your spouses and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: O you who believe! Verily, among your wives and your children there are enemies for you (who may stop you from the obedience of Allâh); therefore beware of them! But if you pardon (them) and overlook, and forgive (their faults), then verily Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: O you who believe, indeed, among your wives and your children are some who are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook, and forgive, then Allah is indeed All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

arabic_text: إِنَّمَآ أَمۡوَٰلُكُمۡ وَأَوۡلَٰدُكُمۡ فِتۡنَةٞۚ وَٱللَّهُ عِندَهُۥٓ أَجۡرٌ عَظِيمٞ

translations.english_saheeh: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and Allāh has with Him a great reward.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Your wealth and your children are only a trial, whereas Allâh! With Him is a great reward (Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and with Allah is a great reward.

arabic_text: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ مَا ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُمۡ وَٱسۡمَعُواْ وَأَطِيعُواْ وَأَنفِقُواْ خَيۡرٗا لِّأَنفُسِكُمۡۗ وَمَن يُوقَ شُحَّ نَفۡسِهِۦ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡمُفۡلِحُونَ
phonetic: 64.16 Fāttaqū Allāha Mā Astaţa`tum Wa Asma`ū Wa 'Aţī`ū Wa 'Anfiqū Khayrāan Li'nfusikum Wa Man Yūqa Shuĥĥa Nafsihi Fa'ūlā'ika Humu Al-Mufliĥūna

translations.english_saheeh: So fear Allāh as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend [in the way of Allāh]; it is better for your selves. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So keep your duty to Allâh and fear Him as much as you can; listen and obey, and spend in charity; that is better for yourselves. And whosoever is saved from his own covetousness, then they are the successful ones.
translations.english_rwwad: So fear Allah as much as you can, listen and obey, and spend in charity; that is better for your souls. Whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul, it is they who are successful.

arabic_text: إِن تُقۡرِضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗا يُضَٰعِفۡهُ لَكُمۡ وَيَغۡفِرۡ لَكُمۡۚ وَٱللَّهُ شَكُورٌ حَلِيمٌ
phonetic: 64.17 'In Tuqriđū Allāha Qarđāan Ĥasanāan Yuđā`ifhu Lakum Wa Yaghfir Lakum Wa Allāhu Shakūrun Ĥalīmun

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1694]- Who gives much in return for little.
[1695]- Refer to footnote in 2:225.

translations.english_saheeh: If you loan Allāh a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allāh is [most] Appreciative[1694] and Forbearing,[1695]
translations.english_hilali_khan: If you lend Allâh a goodly loan (i.e. spend in Allâh’s Cause), He will double it for you, and will forgive you. And Allâh is Most Ready to appreciate and to reward, Most Forbearing,
translations.english_rwwad: If you lend Allah a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you, for Allah is Most Appreciative, Most Forbearing,

translations.english_saheeh: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
translations.english_hilali_khan: All-Knower of the unseen and seen, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
translations.english_rwwad: Knower of the unseen and the seen, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
